data.title: My Upcoming Course on the Philosophy of Nick Land
data.meta_description: Hello, Dangerous Maybe readers, it’s Michael Downs. Let me start by saying that I’m close to posting a very long piece I’ve been working on that centers around Lacan, Žižek, Marx, Deleuze & Guattari…
data.text:
Hello, Dangerous Maybe readers, it’s Michael Downs. Let me start by saying that I’m close to posting a very long piece I’ve been working on that centers around Lacan, Žižek, Marx, Deleuze & Guattari, etc. I know I haven’t posted anything new in a long time but the wait is almost over. With that being said, I want to tell you about something else I have in the works.

I want to officially announce that the next course I’m going to be teaching at Theory Underground will be an introduction to the work of Nick Land and the CCRU. It’ll be a four-week course starting Saturday, October 28. We think it’s perfect to start off a course on Land’s work right around Halloween. But who is Nick Land? A philosopher? A cult leader? A prophet? A charlatan? A magician? A speed-freak? A leftist? A rightist? A Twitter troll? A meme? A human being? A terminator? Let’s find out. I plan on discussing Land’s views on accelerationism, capitalism, artificial intelligence, cybernetics, hyperstition, death, Qabbala, the numogram, templexity, Shanghai, Dark Enlightenment, Bitcoin, and, of course, those time-traveling lemurs.
